title: Digital Twins & CPG Manufacturing Transformation - Consumer Goods Technology
summary: Digital Twins are models that emulate or simulate the behavior of a physical system, updated with data from the physical system, and used to drive a specific business outcome. The four key technologies needed to develop and deploy Digital Twins at scale are: data from the physical system, IoT connectivity, modeling methods, and at-scale computing. These technologies have converged in the 2020s to enable Digital Twins at scale in the consumer packaged goods (CPG) industry.

greenwashing: This article does not describe a product or process that meets the criteria to be greenwashing.

title: Forever chemicals PFAS won't be in office supplies from 3M - Inhabitat
summary: 3M will stop making PFAS chemicals by the end of 2025. This is an important step that sets the tone for other companies and chemical manufacturers. PFAS chemicals, or forever chemicals, are hazardous chemicals that donâ€™t break down over time and can accumulate in the bodies of humans and animals, causing brain damage and diseases such as cancer.
